Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
first and foremost, a notarization is only a notarization if it is included in a block. Which means a block is what secures the notarization. The number of notarizations per block doesn't matter because if you were to compromise the security of the block itself (a 51% on Bitcoin, which we agree isn't likely) then it doesn't matter how many notarizations were included in that block, it's gone. 
So therefore more notarizations in a single block aren't any more secure than a single notarization per block.
